Green Party ‘very confident’ of Darleen Tana investigation and process https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/green-party-very-confident-of-darleen-tana-investigation-and-process/XTTNR4LHEBHJZJUZKVJRUZBHJM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/green-party-very-confident-of-darleen-tana-investigation-and-process/XTTNR4LHEBHJZJUZKVJRUZBHJM/ The Green Party has once again asked Darleen Tana to resign from Parliament. Tue, 16 Jul 2024 00:50:41 +0000 Greens co-leader Chlöe Swarbrick, joined by colleagues Ricardo Menéndez March and Teanau Tuiono, reveals rogue MP Darleen Tana has been told to resign. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Trial for attempted murder of disabled daughter, trying to coerce suicide https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/Trial-for-attempted-murder-of-disabled-daughter-trying-to-coerce-suicide/PCYYREAKT5BF5PGSCWLUKP2SNM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/Trial-for-attempted-murder-of-disabled-daughter-trying-to-coerce-suicide/PCYYREAKT5BF5PGSCWLUKP2SNM/ Denise PiperThe daughter required hospital treatment after the incident, the prosecution says. Tue, 16 Jul 2024 00:50:33 +0000 The parent is charged with attempting to murder their daughter, along with aiding and abetting suicide and perverting the course of justice, in a High Court trial in Whangārei. Photo / Michael Cunningham

World Junior Motocross: Tauranga teen Levi Townley secures title win https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/world-junior-motocross-tauranga-teen-levi-townley-secures-title-win/6PJR4F7AXJHVNH7OLRKRHSLDUA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/world-junior-motocross-tauranga-teen-levi-townley-secures-title-win/6PJR4F7AXJHVNH7OLRKRHSLDUA/ Levi Townley is the first Kiwi rider to claim a world junior motocross title. Waiōuru Military Camp housing stock to be increased, upgraded in $490m project https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/waiouru-military-camp-housing-stock-to-be-increased-upgraded-in-490m-project/TCAOX3M77REGVME3L36QZIOP5M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/waiouru-military-camp-housing-stock-to-be-increased-upgraded-in-490m-project/TCAOX3M77REGVME3L36QZIOP5M/ Fifty new homes will be built in the first $75m stage of the Homes for Families project. Tue, 16 Jul 2024 00:01:12 +0000 Ruapehu Mayor Weston Kirton (centre) and Ruapehu District Council chief executive Clive Manley (second left) met NZ Defence Force personnel Senior Warrant Officer Joe Taipari (left), estate manager Phil Gurnsey and Colonel Lisa Kelliher to discuss housing development plans at Waiōuru Military Camp.
